name: Watch
Brockhampton’s
Kevin
Abstract
in
trailer
for
new
project
content: The band member appeared in a short video clip posted to his Twitter pageBrockhampton’s Kevin Abstract has shared a trailer that appears to be for a new project. The Texan rapper and singer has previously released two solo albums – 2014’s ‘MTV1987’ and 2016’s ‘American Boyfriend: A Suburban Love Story’. Abstract shared the short video clip on his Twitter page earlier today (March 27). The sentences “Teach me empathy”, “Teach me how to feel”, and “ARIZONA baby” are shown in between shots of someone jumping off the roof of a house into a swimming pool, Abstract taking off his shirt, flexing his bicep, and sitting in the back of a car. You can watch it below now.It is currently unclear what the video is for. Last week (March 20), the rapper posted an image on his Twitter page that looked like an album cover. The photo had a Parental Advisory – Explicit Content sticker in the bottom right corner, prompting speculation that the star is preparing to release a new solo record.Meanwhile, last month Brockhampton were nominated for Best International Group at the 2019 BRIT Awards. Speaking to NME on the red carpet, they refused to say much about their next album but said it was “not going to be what anyone expects.” Last year, Abstract spoke about how he wanted to be considered an icon, rather than a queer icon. “In order to make a change, I have to exist in a traditionally homophobic space such as hip-hop,” he said. “If I were to just be this queer rapper, who only spoke to queer kids… I don’t think I could as effectively make a change for another young, black queer kid growing up in Texas.”
